citations.narrative:
The medical records do not contain the identity of the two dogs whose stool samples were collected and tested for
intestinal parasites on April 21, 2023. Not knowing the identity of the dogs cannot ensure that the correct dog will receive
any necessary treatment. The licensee must complete and maintain updated medical records including the identify of the
dogs being tested at the facility. Correct by September 6, 2023.

The licensee has not been recording the names and dates of the vaccines and deworming treatments being administered
to the adult dogs in the kennel. Failure to list the names and dates of all vaccines and deworming treatments administered
makes it difficult the access the animal care program. Licensee must ensure that medical records are kept with the names
and dates of all vaccines and treatments administered to the adult dogs. Correct by September 6, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(b)(1) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The medical records do not contain the identity of the two dogs whose stool samples were collected and tested for 
intestinal parasites on April 21, 2023. Not knowing the identity of the dogs cannot ensure that the correct dog will receive 
any necessary treatment. The licensee must complete and maintain updated medical records including the identify of the 
dogs being tested at the facility. Correct by September 6, 2023. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee has not been recording the names and dates of the vaccines and deworming treatments being administered 
to the adult dogs in the kennel. Failure to list the names and dates of all vaccines and deworming treatments administered 
makes it difficult the access the animal care program. Licensee must ensure that medical records are kept with the names 
and dates of all vaccines and treatments administered to the adult dogs. Correct by September 6, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
